conclusion: Analyze the motion of the ball in several stages: gravitational slide, collision, vertical motion, horizontal motion, and projectile motion.
Potential energy at point P is converted into kinetic energy at the bottom of the inclined plane.
Calculate the length of the inclined plane AB as L = 5h/3.
Calculate the work done by friction as W_f = 4mhg/9.
Determine the kinetic energy at the bottom of the inclined plane as K = 5mhg/9.
Solve for v_1, the speed of the ball at the bottom of the inclined plane, as v_1 = sqrt(2gh)/3.
Determine the speed of the ball after the elastic collision on track BC as v_2 = 2sqrt(2gh)/3.
Calculate the maximum height y reached during vertical motion through pipe CD using energy conservation.
Determine the condition for the ball to barely pass the highest point E of the semi-circle DEF as h >= 1.125 meters.
Since the minimum value of h is given as 0.45 meters, proceed with that value.
